== Introduction ==

We are preparing Kubuntu Mantic Minotaur (23.10) for release in  <nowiki>[[https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/mantic-minotaur-release-schedule/34989 | October, 2023]]</nowiki>. With this '''Beta''' pre-release, you can see what we are testing in preparation for our next version.

'''NOTE:''' 

This is Beta Release. 
Kubuntu '''Beta Releases''' are '''NOT''' recommended for:
* Regular users who are not aware of pre-release issues
* Anyone who needs a stable system
* Anyone uncomfortable running a possibly frequently broken system
* Anyone in a production environment with data or workflows that need to be reliable

Kubuntu Beta Releases are recommended for:
* Regular users who want to help us test by finding, reporting, and/or fixing bugs
* Kubuntu, KDE, and Qt developers

Please '''report your installation results''' on the <nowiki>[[http://iso.qa.ubuntu.com/qatracker|Release tracker]]</nowiki>.

General bug reporting guidelines can be found here: ReportingBugs.

== Getting Kubuntu 23.10 Beta ==

=== Upgrading from 23.04 ===

To upgrade to a Kubuntu 23.10 pre-release version, run '''sudo do-release-upgrade -d''' from a command line.

=== Download a Disk Image ===

Download a <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/releases/23.10/beta/|Bootable image]]</nowiki>. Direct downloads, torrents, and zysnc are available as options.

== New features and changes in 23.10 Beta ==
=== Core desktop and applications ===

==== Plasma 5.27: simple by default, powerful when needed ====

<nowiki>[[File:PlasmaMM.png||width=800]]</nowiki>

<nowiki>[[https://kde.org/announcements/plasma/5/5.27.0/|Plasma 5.27]]</nowiki> has been developed to make it smoother to use while retaining the familiar setup. Plasma 5.27 is intended to be an LTS, <nowiki>[[https://community.kde.org/Schedules/Plasma_5|to be supported at least until Plasma 6.0 is released]]</nowiki>. 23.10 Beta ships with the 8th bugfix release (5.27.8)

==== KDE Applications updates, including KDE Gear 23.08.1 and other updated apps ====

<nowiki>[[File:AppsMM.png||width=800]]</nowiki>

==== Web browser and office suite ====

* <nowiki>[[https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/117.0/releasenotes//|Firefox 117]]</nowiki> snap is the default browser from the <nowiki>[[https://snapcraft.io/firefox|Snap Store]]</nowiki>.
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.documentfoundation.org/ReleaseNotes/7.6|LibreOffice 7.6]]</nowiki> is provided by default in the full installation.

==== Qt and KDE Frameworks ====

Kubuntu 23.04 Beta ships with Qt 5.15.10 and KDE Frameworks Version: 5.110.

==== Pipewire ====

Pipewire has been the default audio backend since 22.10, replacing pulseaudio.

== Other highlights/notes ==

=== Plasma Wayland session ===

* A Plasma Wayland session is available for testing, but is not currently supported. A Wayland session can be started by selecting it at the login screen. 

=== Flatpaks ===

To enable Flatpaks in KDEâ€™s Discover in Kubuntu 23.10, run this command:<pre>

sudo apt install flatpak plasma-discover-backend-flatpak
</pre>
To enable the largest Flatpak repository, run this command:<pre>

flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo
</pre>
Log out and log back in (or restart) to re-initialize the XDG_DATA_DIRS variable, otherwise, newly installed Flatpak apps will not run or appear in the startup menu.

== Feedback ==

Development of Kubuntu 23.10, Mantic Minotaur, is ongoing and bugs are fixed every day.  Before reporting bugs, please ensure your system is up to date.  For verifying installation related bugs, updated disk images are available from <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/daily-live/current/|Daily bootable images for standard PCs and laptops]]</nowiki>.

You can give us feedback on <nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/kubuntu.org|Facebook]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/kubuntu.org|<nowiki>[[File:Kubuntu-FB.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] or <nowiki>[[https://twitter.com/kubuntu|Twitter]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[https://twitter.com/kubuntu|<nowiki>[[File:Kubuntu-Twitter.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]].
